title: Mavis Gallant - Short Stories (7 books)
description:
MAVIS GALLANT (1922-2014) was an acclaimed and award-winning Canadian writer who spent much of her life and career living in France.  Her short stories exhibit an intricate simplicity and spare complexity that many critics have likened to Henry James and Anton Chekhov.  She won the Governor General's Award for English-language fiction in 1981.


All the following books are in ePUB format:

* ACROSS THE BRIDGE (McClelland & Stewart, 1997).  With an Afterword by Robertson Davies.

* THE COLLECTED STORIES (Random House, 1996).

* THE COST OF LIVING: Early and Uncollected Stories (New York Review Books, 2009).

* MONTREAL STORIES (McClelland & Stewart, 2004).  Introduction by Russell Banks.

* OVERHEAD IN A BALLOON (McClelland & Stewart, 2002). 

* PARIS STORIES (New York Review Books, 2002).  Selected and with an Introduction by Michael Ondaatje.

* VARIETIES OF EXILE (New York Review Books, 2003).  Selected and with an Introduction by Russell Banks.
